revision.text:
The '''Electronic Retailing Self-Regulation Program''' ('''ERSP''') is a self-regulatory program created in 2004 by American business organizations to promote consumer confidence. ERSP is a program of the Electronic Retailing Association http://www.retailing.org in conjunction with the [[National Advertising Review Council]] (NARC) and administered by the Council of [[Better Business Bureaus]]. The mission of the program is to enhance consumer confidence in electronic retailing, by providing a forum to self-regulate [[direct response advertising]]. ERSP was created for several reasons, to: improve consumer confidence in electronic retailing; demonstrate the strong commitment of this industry to effective self-regulation; provide a quick and efficient mechanism for review of high-profile [[advertising]] (such as weight-loss advertising) and affecting the discontinuance of advertising containing egregious claims. ERSP investigates the truth and accuracy of claims in direct response advertising from inquiries brought to ERSP’s attention through competitor’s challenges, consumer’s concerns, or through ERSP’s ongoing monitoring program. Working as a voluntary program, ERSP is an efficient and useful tool to assist direct response marketers with timely and cost effective measures to minimize government interference and increase consumer confidence. The direct response industry includes long-form ([[infomercial]]) productions, short-form [[commercials]], live home [[shopping channels]], print advertising, Internet marketing, cell phone advertising, [[broadband]] channels, and radio advertising. Anything that has a direct link to the marketer: either a 1-[[800 number]], [[email]], or [[website]] is within ERSP’s purview. ERSP inquires about the evidentiary support that a marketer possesses for product claims communicated through any form of direct-response advertising. Advertising claims come to ERSP’s attention through competitive challenges and ERSP’s ongoing monitoring program. Among the most significant benefits afforded by this program are:
• '''speed''' – the ERSP mandate is to resolve all inquiries within 60 calendar days
• '''cost''' –low cost alternative to litigation
• '''burden of proof''' – ERSP does not require that injury to a consumer be proven as may be required by law and
• '''confidentiality''' – a company may bring cases anonymously to ERSP and, conversely, any proprietary information submitted confidentially will remain so in an ERSP challenge.
The 60-day structure of this program is vital in limiting marketer inconvenience, but comprehensive enough to provide a thorough review. The success of the program lies in the voluntary participation by direct response marketers and the nature of the self-regulatory format. With the beneficial nature of this format for the electronic retailing industry, ERSP looks forward to not only continuing its monitoring program but to addressing the challenges brought by both consumers and competitors of electronic marketing. Core claims at issue in an ERSP inquiry might include: • Establishment Claims (“Clinically proven”)
• Performance Claims (how well a product performs)
• Testimonials (Anecdotal tales from consumers about their results with the product)
• Weight Loss Claims
• Health and Safety
• Disclosures
• Before and After Photographs
• Puffery
• Comparative Claims ERSP opened its first case in August 2004. == How the ERSP Process Works == ERSP details its concerns in an initial letter of inquiry and the marketer is given 15 calendar days to respond to ERSP with substantiation for the issues raised. ERSP then has 15 calendar days to ask the marketer for more information regarding its submission. Upon receipt of that request the marketer has 10 days to answer ERSP’s questions, and upon receipt of that, ERSP has 15 calendar days to reach a decision. If a marketer does not respond to the initial inquiry letter by ERSP, a press release summarizing the claims at issue and announcing a 10-calendar-day response for the marketer is released. == ERSP Determinations – What to Expect == Participants in an ERSP review can anticipate one of three results: • ERSP determines that the core claims at issue are supported by reasonable evidence.
• ERSP recommends the marketer modify core claims.
• ERSP determines there is no support for the claims at issue and recommends that the advertiser pull the advertisement. ERSP also refers marketers to the appropriate [[regulatory agency]] if they fail to respond or refuse to comply with ERSP’s findings. Compliance inquiries are also conducted to confirm compliance with ERSP recommendations.
== ERSP Review Program == In January 2012, the Electronic Retailing Self-Regulation Program (ERSP) expanded its purview to monitor and review advertising of the coaching and mentoring and live seminar industry. The program is called the “ERSP Review Program.” The ERSP Review Program has two fundamental components: 1) review of telemarketing practices and free live seminar events which include telesales phone calls, scripts and recordings of free, live seminar events ; 2) monitoring of lead generation advertising applicable to the coaching and mentoring industry including print, broadcast and online advertising. == ERSP Copy Review == In 2014 ERSP introduced its Copy Reviewservice which is offered to members of the direct response industry and provides a review of advertising and the reasonable messages being communicated in the advertisement (usually conducted before the advertising is nationally disseminated). The review is focused on the legal, regulatory, self-regulatory and/or statutory provisions that should be considered and/or adhered to with respect to representations (express or implied) disseminated in an advertisement. Unlike a preclearance service which entails a comprehensive review of a marketer’s substantiation, a copy review evaluation is a “''non evidentiary''” review and is limited to “''primary''” and “''core''” claims communicated in an advertisement. Consumer complaints can be sent into ERSP via this [http://savvyshopper.org/savvyshopper/complaintlog/complaint_frame.htm complaint form].
Copies of previous ERSP case reports are located [http://www.narcpartners.org/ersp/index.aspx here]. ==External links== * [http://www.narcpartners.org/ersp/ National Advertising Review Council] [[Category:Retailing]] [[Category:Advertising in the United States]] [[Category:Business ethics]] [[Category:Self-regulation]]

revision.text:
The '''Financial Accounting Foundation''' ('''FAF''') is located in [[Norwalk, Connecticut]], [[United States]]. It was organized in 1972 as a non-stock, [[Delaware Corporation]]. It is an independent organization in the private sector, operating with the goal of ensuring objectivity and integrity in financial reporting standards.
The foundation is responsible for:<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fasb.org/faf/faf_info.shtml|title=Overview|website=www.fasb.org}}</ref>
* Establishing and improving financial accounting and reporting standards; * Educating constituents about those standards; * The oversight, administration, and finances of its standard-setting Boards, the [[Financial Accounting Standards Board]] (FASB) and the [[Governmental Accounting Standards Board]] (GASB), and their Advisory Councils; * Selecting the members of the standard-setting Boards and Advisory Councils; and * Protecting the independence and integrity of the standard-setting process.
FAF operates four branches in its organization: * [[FASB]] * [[Governmental Accounting Standards Board|GASB]] * The Financial Accounting Standards Advisory Council (FASAC). This branch is composed of FASB constituents and consults with FASB on issues. * The Governmental Accounting Standards Advisory Council (GASAC). This branch is composed of GASB constituents and consults with GASB on issues.
The FAF Board of Trustees is made up of members from constituent organizations having interest in financial reporting. These constituent organizations include:
*[[American Accounting Association]] *[[American Institute of Certified Public Accountants]] *[[CFA Institute]] *Financial Executives International *[[Government Finance Officers Association]] *[[Institute of Management Accountants]] *National Association of State Auditors, Comptrollers and Treasurers *[[Securities Industry and Financial Markets Association]]
There are currently five officers and fourteen trustees. The FAF operates seven committees: * the Executive Committee * the Development Committee * the Appointments and Evaluations Committee * the Finance and Compensation Committee * the Audit Committee * the Standard-Setting Process Oversight Advisory Committee * the Corporate Governance Committee
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Accounting in the United States]] [[Category:Self-regulatory organizations in the United States]] [[Category:Companies based in Norwalk, Connecticut]] [[Category:1972 establishments in Connecticut]] {{US-org-stub}}

revision.text:
The '''Glass Age Development Committee''' was established in 1937 by [[Pilkington]] to promote the use of [[glass]] as a building material in the [[United Kingdom]].<ref>{{cite journal|date=April 1964|title=A Multi-Purpose Seven Storey Bridge Project for the Thames in London|journal=Indian Concrete Journal|volume=38|pages=136}}</ref> It commissioned designs for many large-scale schemes, none of which were ever built.
Initially its name was the Glass Age Town Planning Committee. The first committee consisted of first-generation modern architects Maxwell Fry, R Furneaux Jordan, Raymond McGrath, Howard Robertson, G Grey Wornum and FRS Yorke. Each was asked to ‘suggest solutions to certain problems of town planning in London, Edinburgh, Liverpool and Bournemouth’, using ‘all the structural and decorative resources of the Glass Age, but [to] produce practical schemes that could actually be built. An imaginative use of modern materials, rather than mere romantic fantasy was desired’. This being a marketing tool led by Pilkington, most of the problems were as unrealistic as the solutions. The designs followed early CIAM ideals in sweeping away historical areas such as The Strand and Bond Street in London, and Princes Street in Edinburgh in favour of extrusions of stacked floorplates walled in glass similar to the Miesian skyscrapers c1920.<ref>Steve Parnell (2014) "In praise of advertising", ''The Architectural Review''</ref>
During the 50s the Committee was formed by Geoffrey A. Jellicoe, Edward D. Mills and Ove Arup & Partners; and it was joined by other architects for individual projects. The design briefs were for Britain in the year 2000, but realistic in that they were to make use of technology that was already available.<ref>''Architecture and Design for the Family in Britain, 1900-1970''; by David Jeremiah (2000)</ref> Notable schemes included a proposal in 1955 to demolish the entire area of [[Soho]] and rebuild it entirely in glass;<ref>{{cite book|last=Jenks|first=Chris|title=Urban Culture|publisher=Taylor & Francis|location=London|year=2004|pages=226|isbn=0-415-30497-0}}</ref> a 1957 proposal for the replacement of [[St Giles Circus]] in London with a {{convert|150|ft|m|adj=on}} tall glass [[heliport]];<ref>{{cite journal|year=1957|title=Crystal Gazing|journal=Aircraft Engineering and Aerospace Technology|volume=29|issue=4|pages=97|doi=10.1108/eb032812}}</ref> and the 1963 "Crystal Span" proposal for the replacement of [[London]]'s [[Vauxhall Bridge]] with a seven-story glass building straddling the [[River Thames]],<ref>{{cite book|last=Cookson|first=Brian|title=Crossing the River|publisher=Mainstream|location=Edinburgh|year=2006|isbn=1-84018-976-2|oclc=63400905|page=150}}</ref> which was to have contained a shopping mall, luxury hotel, residential development and a museum to house the [[modern art]] collection now housed at [[Tate Modern]].<ref>{{cite book|last=Jeremiah|first=David|title=Architecture and Design for the Family in Britain 1900–70|publisher=Manchester University Press|location=Manchester|year=2000|isbn=0-7190-5889-9|oclc=186445752|page=175}}</ref>
The Glass Age Development Committee is best known for its ambitious 1968 proposal for a glass and concrete [[Seasteading|offshore city]] housing 21,000 people,<ref>{{Cite news|url=|title=City at Sea to House 30,000|last=|first=|date=29 February 1968|newspaper=Times|access-date=|work=|via=}}</ref><ref name="Sea City">{{cite web |url=http://library.thinkquest.org/C0115965/english/info/future/sea.htm |work=Future City Types |title=Sea City |accessdate=2009-05-22 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080408032505/http://library.thinkquest.org/C0115965/english/info/future/sea.htm |archivedate=2008-04-08 |df= }}</ref> to be anchored off the coast near [[Great Yarmouth]] and accessed from the mainland by [[hovercraft]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aiai.ed.ac.uk/~bat/sea-city.html|title=Sea City|publisher=Austin Tate|accessdate=2009-05-22}}</ref> The development was to have been called Sea City. The structure would have been {{convert|4700|ft|m}} long and {{convert|3300|ft|m}} wide, and would have rested on concrete islands supported by [[pier (architecture)|piers]].<ref name="Sea City" /> It was intended that the development would have been economically self-sufficient thanks to [[boatbuilding]] workshops, [[fish farming]], and the export of fresh water from an onboard [[desalination]] plant, while a lagoon in the centre of the development would support a tourist industry based on [[Scuba diving|skin diving]] and [[water skiing]].<ref name="Sea City" />
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Glass architecture]] [[Category:Glass industry]]

revision.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contribs/194.61.223.64|194.61.223.64]] ([[User talk:194.61.223.64|talk]]) to last version by Mais oui!
revision.text:
{{infobox Organization |name = Home Builders Federation |image = File:Home Builders Federation logo.jpg |size = |abbreviation = HBF |motto = |formation = 1939 |extinction = |type = Trade association |status = Non-profit company |purpose = Home building industry in the UK |headquarters = London SE1 |region_served = [[England]] and [[Wales]] |membership = private sector house-builders |language = |leader_title = |leader_name = |main_organ = |parent_organization = |affiliations = |num_staff = |num_volunteers = |budget = |website = [http://www.hbf.co.uk/ hbf.co.uk] |remarks = }} The '''Home Builders Federation''' (HBF) is a [[trade association]] representing private sector homebuilders in [[England]] and [[Wales]]. Its members deliver around 80% of new homes built each year.<ref>[http://www.hbf.co.uk/media-centre/company-overview/ HBF company overview]. Accessed 19 February 2016.</ref>
==History== The HBF can trace its roots back to 1939 and the establishment of the '''National Association of House Builders'''.<ref name=honourboards>[http://www.honourboards.co.uk/association_honour_boards.html Federations, Institutes & Associations] Accessed: 16 February 2016.</ref> This became the '''Federation of Registered House Builders''' in 1946 (representing the housing element of the [[National Federation of Building Trades Employers]], NFBTE, in whose annual reports its activities were described),<ref name="Warwick records">{{cite web|title=Collection: National Federation of Building Trades Employers (NFBTE), earlier the Association of Master Builders of Great Britain|url=http://dscalm.warwick.ac.uk/DServe/dserve.exe?dsqIni=DServe2.ini&dsqApp=Archive&dsqCmd=FastTree.tcl&dsqDb=Catalog&dsqItem=FBT%2F1%2F1&dsqField=RefNo|website=Warwick University|accessdate=19 February 2016}}</ref> and the '''House Builders Federation''' in 1970.<ref name=honourboards />
From 1997 to 2000 it was part of the NFBTE successor umbrella organisation, the [[Construction Confederation]], but started to withdraw in 2000,<ref name="HBF to leave CC">{{cite news|title=House Builders’ Federation set to quit Confederation|url=http://www.building.co.uk/house-builders8217-federation-set-to-quit-confederation/592.article|accessdate=19 February 2016|work=Building|issue=20|date=2000}}</ref> voting in 2001 to terminate its membership by January 2003.<ref name="Clark">{{cite news|last1=Clark|first1=Phil|title=HBF finally pulls out of the Construction Confederation|url=http://www.building.co.uk/hbf-finally-pulls-out-of-the-construction-confederation/1009206.article|accessdate=19 February 2016|work=Building|issue=27|date=2001}}</ref>
It changed its name to the '''Home Builders Federation''' in 2005.
==Structure== HBF members include national names (e.g. [[Barratt Developments]], [[Crest Nicholson]]) and smaller local businesses, plus [[Registered Social Landlord]]s, suppliers and companies who provide professional services to the home building industry.
==Activities== The HBF represents member interests on a national and regional level, addressing technical issues (e.g. regulations and standards), planning issues, and health and safety, among other areas.
It also represents home building interests by attending meetings of the [[Strategic Forum for Construction]].<ref name="TCI re SFfC">{{cite news|title=Relaunch for construction’s Strategic Forum|url=http://www.theconstructionindex.co.uk/news/view/relaunch-for-constructions-strategic-forum|accessdate=19 February 2016|work=The Construction Index|date=19 February 2016}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.hbf.co.uk/ HBF website]

revision.text:
{{BLP sources|date=June 2009}} '''Jean Gandois''', [[Honorary Member of the Order of Australia|AM]] (born 7 May 1930, [[Nieul]], [[Haute-Vienne]]) is a French businessman.
==Education== He is a former pupil of the French [[École polytechnique]], where he graduated in 1949, as an engineer of bridges & road construction.
==Career== From 1954 to 1960 he worked on public projects in [[Guinea]], as an expert for the road programs of [[Brazil]] and [[Peru]]. In 1961 he returned to France and worked for the Wendel Group. After various positions, in 1972, he became general manager of [[Sacilor]], then Chairman and managing Director of [[Sollac]]. In 1976 he started working at the [[Rhône-Poulenc]], eventually becoming Chief Executive Officer.<ref name="CoignardGuichard2000">{{cite book|last1=Coignard|first1=Sophie|last2=Guichard|first2=Marie-Thérèse|title=French Connections:Networks of Influence|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=GVyohk7knogC&pg=PA162|accessdate=25 February 2011|year=2000|publisher=Algora Publishing|isbn=978-1-892941-02-2|page=162}}</ref> He left the group in 1982 and until 1986 he worked as an international consultant. In 1986 he became Chairman and managing Director of the Pechiney Group. He left them in 1994 to take the chair of the National Council of French Employers ([[CNPF]], old name of Medef). Feeling betrayed by the government, he resigned in 1997 after the [[socialist]] government voted a law for the 35 hours work week. From 1987 to 1999 he worked as a crisis manager for Cockerill Sambre. He is currently a president of the board of trustees of Suez. He is a member of the Belgian businessclub [[Cercle de Lorraine]].
In 1995 he was appointed an Honorary Member of the [[Order of Australia]] (AM), "for service to Australian-French relations, particularly in the business sphere".<ref>[http://www.itsanhonour.gov.au/honours/honour_roll/search.cfm?aus_award_id=1042994&search_type=advanced&showInd=true It's an Honour]</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}

{{pp-pc1}} {{Use mdy dates|date=August 2018}} {{Use American English|date=June 2016}} {{Infobox model | name = Kendall Jenner | image = Kendal Jenner Cannes 2017.jpg | caption = Jenner in May 2017 | birth_name = Kendall Nicole Jenner | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1995|11|03}} | birth_place = [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], U.S. | occupation = {{flat list| * Fashion model * television personality }} | parents = {{plainlist| * [[Caitlyn Jenner]] * [[Kris Jenner]] }} | relatives = {{plainlist| * [[Kylie Jenner]] (sister) * [[Kourtney Kardashian]] (half-sister) * [[Kim Kardashian]] (half-sister) * [[Khloé Kardashian]] (half-sister) * [[Rob Kardashian]] (half-brother) * [[Brandon Jenner]] (half-brother) * [[Brody Jenner]] (half-brother) }} | years_active = 2007–present | height = {{height|ft=5|in=10.5}} | haircolor = Brown | eyecolor = Brown | agency = [[The Society Management]] (New York)
[[Elite Model Management]] (Paris, Milan, London){{cite web|url=https://models.com/models/kendall-jenner|title=Kendall Jenner - Model|publisher=|accessdate=October 9, 2018}} }} '''Kendall Nicole Jenner''' (born November 3, 1995){{cite web |last = Nesvig |first = Kara |date = November 3, 2015 |title = 10 Reasons Why Kendall Jenner Would Make the Perfect Sister in honor of her 20th birthday |url = http://www.teenvogue.com/story/kendall-jenner-perfect-sister |work = [[Teen Vogue]] |publisher = [[Condé Nast]] ([[Advance Publications]]) | accessdate = November 22, 2015 }} is an American model and television personality. Originally appearing in the [[E!]] reality television show ''[[Keeping Up with the Kardashians]]'', Jenner is now also a model in a movement dubbed "the Instagirl era" by ''[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]'' magazine, or "Social Media Modeling" by ''[[Harper's Bazaar]]'', where models are chosen for their online presence and social media following.{{cite news |url = https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/style/celebrity-fashion/how-instagram-made-kendall-jenner-7531087 |title = How Instagram made Kendall Jenner, Gigi Hadid and Karlie Kloss the new generation of supermodels |last = Graafland |first = Amber |date = March 10, 2016 |work = [[Daily Mirror]] |publisher = Mirror Group Newspapers PLC ([[Trinity Mirror]]) |access-date = March 10, 2016 }}{{cite web |last = Rutherford |first = Chrissy |date = November 16, 2014 |title = The Era of the Social Media Models |url = http://www.harpersbazaar.com/fashion/models/g5006/social-media-models/?slide=1 |work = [[Harper's Bazaar]] |publisher = [[Hearst Corporation]] |accessdate = June 18, 2015 }} After working in commercial print ad campaigns and [[photoshoots]], Jenner had breakout seasons in 2014 and 2015, walking the runways for high fashion designers during the [[New York Fashion Week|New York]], [[Milan Fashion Week|Milan]], and [[Paris Fashion Week|Paris]] Fashion Weeks. Jenner has done multiple editorials and cover shoots for ''[[LOVE (magazine)|LOVE]]'' and various international ''Vogue'' editions, walked for [[Victoria's Secret]], and acts as brand ambassador for [[Estée Lauder Companies|Estée Lauder's]]{{cite web|url=https://www.esteelauder.com/estee-stories-article-3-minutes-kendall-jenner|title=Estée Lauder Official Site|publisher=|accessdate=October 9, 2018}} multimedia ad campaigns. Jenner made her debut at No. 16 on ''[[Forbes]]'' magazine's 2015 list of top earning models, with an estimated annual income of {{US$|4{{nbsp}}million|link=yes}}.{{cite journal |last = Robehmed |first = Natalie |date = September 17, 2015 |title = The World's Highest-Paid Models 2015: Gisele Leads, Kendall Joins |url = https://www.forbes.com/sites/natalierobehmed/2015/09/17/the-worlds-highest-paid-models-2015-gisele-leads-kendall-joins/ |work = [[Forbes]] |publisher = Forbes Media LLC. | accessdate = September 24, 2015 }} As of April 2017, she is one of the top 15 most followed celebrities on [[Instagram]].{{cite web|url=https://socialblade.com/instagram/top/100/followers|title=Top 100 Instagram Users by Followers}} In 2017, Jenner takes the top World's Highest-Paid Model on the ''[[Forbes]]'' top-earning models list.{{cite news |first= Natalie |last=Robehmed |title=Highest-Paid Models 2017: Kendall Jenner Takes Crown From Gisele With $22M Year |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/natalierobehmed/2017/11/21/highest-paid-models-2017-kendall-jenner-ousts-gisele-with-22-million/#4834c23e2b5c |accessdate=November 21, 2017}} == Early life== Jenner was born in Los Angeles, California, to retired [[1976 Summer Olympics|Olympic]] decathlete champion [[Caitlyn Jenner]] (previously Bruce) and television personality [[Kris Jenner]].{{efn|name=a|Kris is Kendall's biological mother. Caitlyn [[Transitioning (transgender)|transitioned]] from male to female in 2015.{{cite web |last = Bissinger |first = Buzz |title = Introducing Caitlyn Jenner |url = http://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2015/06/caitlyn-jenner-bruce-cover-annie-leibovitz/ |work = [[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]] |publisher = [[Condé Nast]] ([[Advance Publications]]) |date = June 1, 2015 |accessdate = December 1, 2015 }}}} Jenner's middle name was a tribute to her mother's best friend [[Nicole Brown Simpson]], who died just before Jenner was conceived.{{cite journal |last = Gray |first = Lorna |date = April 12, 2016 |title = Kendall Jenner explains the importance behind her middle name ‘Nicole’ |url = http://www.cosmopolitan.com.au/celebrity/celebrity-gossip/2016/4/kendall-jenner-explains-importance-behind-middle-name-nicole |work = [[Cosmopolitan (magazine)|Cosmopolitan]] |publisher = [[Hearst Corporation]] |access-date = April 12, 2016 }} Jenner was raised in a [[stepfamily]] with one younger sister, [[Kylie Jenner|Kylie]], and eight half-siblings. Jenner is half sister to Burt and Casey Lynn Jenner through Caitlyn and first wife Christie Crownover. Through Caitlyn and second wife [[Linda Thompson (actress)|Linda Thompson]], Jenner is half sister to indie pop singer [[Brandon Jenner|Brandon]] and ''[[The Hills (TV series)|The Hills]]'' actor [[Brody Jenner|Sam "Brody" Jenner]]. Jenner is maternal half sister to reality television celebrities [[Kourtney Kardashian|Kourtney]], [[Kim Kardashian|Kim]], [[Khloé Kardashian|Khloé]], and [[Rob Kardashian]]{{cite journal |last = Challis |first = Carla |date = September 18, 2015 |title = Who are the Kardashians and the Jenners? Your guide to Kylie, Kim, Caitlyn and the family |url = http://home.bt.com/lifestyle/who-are-the-kardashians-and-the-jenners-your-guide-to-kylie-kim-caitlyn-and-the-family-11363984898071 |publisher = [[BT Group]] |accessdate = September 24, 2015 }} through mother Kris Jenner. Jenner was raised with her sister and maternal half-siblings in [[Calabasas, California|Calabasas]], an upscale suburb west of Los Angeles. Jenner attended [[Sierra Canyon School]] before switching to [[homeschooling]] in order to pursue modeling.{{cite news |url = https://www.nytimes.com/2013/06/09/fashion/kendall-jenner-a-sister-who-does-more-than-keep-up-with-the-kardashians.html |title = Kendall Jenner, a Sister Who Does More Than Keep Up |work = [[The New York Times]] |publisher = [[The New York Times Company]] |date = June 7, 2013 |first = Lauren |last = Lipton |accessdate = December 2, 2015 }} She graduated in 2014.{{cite web |url = http://www.elle.com/culture/celebrities/news/a29475/kendall-kylie-jenner-graduation-party/ |title = Kendall and Kylie Jenner Got a Crazy Surprise Graduation Party |work = [[Elle (magazine)|Elle]] |publisher = [[Hachette Filipacchi Médias]] |date = July 24, 2015 |first = Alyssa |last = Bailey |accessdate = December 2, 2015 }} == Modeling == === 2009–2013: Early work === Jenner began modeling at age 14 when [[Wilhelmina Models]] signed her on July 12, 2009.{{cite web |url = http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/youngest-kardashian-14-signs-on-to-modeling-agency-201061 |title = Youngest Kardashian, 14, Signs On to Modeling Agency |work = [[Us Weekly]] |publisher = Wenner Media LLC |date = January 6, 2010 |accessdate = November 16, 2014 }} Cinematographer [[Nick Saglimbeni]] directed the photoshoot for Jenner's Wilhelmina portfolio.{{cite web |url = http://nicksaglimbeni.com/the-making-of-a-superstar-kendall-jenner-part-1-of-2/ |title = The Making of a Superstar: Kendall Jenner, Part 1 of 2 |last = Saglimbeni |first = Nick |date = July 27, 2010 |work = Nick Saglimbeni |access-date = April 6, 2016 }}{{cite web |url = http://nicksaglimbeni.com/the-making-of-a-superstar-kendall-jenner-part-2-of-2/ |title = The Making of a Superstar: Kendall Jenner, Part 2 of 2 |last = Saglimbeni |first = Nick |date = September 8, 2010 |work = Nick Saglimbeni |access-date = April 6, 2016 }} Jenner's first modeling job was the ''Rocker Babes with a Twist'' campaign for [[Forever 21]] in December 2009 and January 2010.{{cite web |last = DiNunno |first = Gina |date = June 1, 2010 |title = Kardashian Sister Lands a Modeling Gig |url = http://www.tvguide.com/news/kardashian-sister-lands-1013422/ |work = [[TV Guide]] |publisher = NTVB Media ([[CBS Corporation]]) |accessdate = June 19, 2015 }}{{cite web |date = December 15, 2009 |title = Keeping Up with the Kardashians' Kendall Jenner Models for Forever 21 |url = http://stylenews.peoplestylewatch.com/2009/12/15/keeping-up-with-the-kardashians-kendall-jenner-models-for-forever-21/ |work = [[People (magazine)|People]] |publisher=[[Time Inc]] |accessdate = November 16, 2014 }} Jenner featured in a ''[[Teen Vogue]]'' Snapshot on April 19, 2010.{{cite web |date = April 18, 2010 |title = Teen Vogue Snapshot: Kendall Jenner |url = http://www.teenvogue.com/story/best-dressed-reader-of-the-day-kendall-jenner |work = [[Teen Vogue]] |publisher = [[Condé Nast]] ([[Advance Publications]]) | accessdate = November 17, 2014 }} In September 2011, Jenner walked for [[Sherri Hill]] during [[Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week]].{{cite web |url = http://mbfashionweek.com/gallery/sherri-hill-runway-ss12 |title = Sherri Hill: Runway SS12 |work = [[Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week]] |publisher = [[IMG (company)|IMG Worldwide]] |accessdate = May 17, 2015 }}{{cite news |url = |publisher = [[E! News]] ([[NBCUniversal]]) |accessdate = June 18, 2015 }} By the end of 2012, Jenner had covers on ''[[American Cheerleader]]'',{{cite news |url = http://www.eonline.com/photos/3221/kendall-jenner-s-first-cover-shoot |author = |date = n.d. |title = Kendall Jenner's First Cover Shoot! |publisher = E! Cheering! |url = http://www.teen.com/2011/04/29/celebrities/celebrity-quotes/kendall-jenner-american-cheerleader-magazin/ |work = [[Teen (magazine)|Teen]] |accessdate = September 24, 2015 }} ''Teen Prom'',{{cite web |url = http://www.kendallandkylie.com/my-teen-prom-cover-12-2011 |title = My 'Teen Prom' Cover! |last = Jenner |first = Kendall |date = n.d. |work = Kendall & Kylie Jenner |deadurl = yes |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20150709212758/http://www.kendallandkylie.com/my-teen-prom-cover-12-2011 |archive-date = July 9, 2015 |accessdate = November 21, 2015 }} ''Looks'', |accessdate = December 1, 2015 |date = May 30, 2012 |first = Tiffany |last = Wan |work = [[Wetpaint]] |publisher = Viggle Inc. }} and booked campaigns for White Sands Australia,{{cite news |url = http://www.eonline.com/photos/4885/kendall-kylie-jenner-s-modeling-pics/179785 |title = Kendall & Kylie Jenner's Modeling Pics: Kendall's White Sands Bikini Ads |author = |date = n.d. |publisher = [[E! News]] ([[NBCUniversal]]) |accessdate = March 11, 2016 }} Leah Madden,{{cite web |last = Pfeiffer |first = Kim |date = August 4, 2011 |title = Kendall Jenner Suits Up for Australian Swimwear Line |url = http://stylenews.peoplestylewatch.com/2011/08/04/kendall-jenner-bikini-model/ |work = [[People (magazine)|People]] |publisher = [[Time Inc]] |accessdate = June 18, 2015 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150714182942/http://stylenews.peoplestylewatch.com/2011/08/04/kendall-jenner-bikini-model/ |archivedate = July 14, 2015 |df = mdy-all }} and [[Agua Bendita]].{{cite news |url = http://www.eonline.com/news/424794/kendall-jenner-is-stunning-in-new-agua-bendita-bikini-photoshoot |title = Kendall Jenner Looks Stunning in New Agua Bendita Bikini Photoshoot |last = Chen |first = Tanya |date = May 31, 2013 |publisher = E! News (NBCUniversal) |accessdate = June 18, 2015 }} In November 2012, Jenner teamed with Victoria's Secret photographer [[Russell James]] for editorial work and joint projects. Over the course of 2013 and 2014, their work together surfaced in ''Kurv'',{{cite web |url = http://www.etonline.com/fashion/151413_tabloid_claims_kendall_jenner_is_too_fat_for_runway/ |title = Tabloid Says Kendall Jenner Is 'Too Fat for Runway' |date = September 19, 2014 |first = Antoinette |last = Bueno |accessdate = December 1, 2015 |publisher = [[CBS Television Distribution]] ([[CBS Corporation]]) |work = [[Entertainment Tonight]] }} ''Miss Vogue Australia'',{{cite web |date = November 26, 2012 |title = Behind the scenes: Kendall Jenner for Miss Vogue |url = http://www.vogue.com.au/miss+vogue/news/behind+the+scenes+kendall+jenner+for+miss+vogue,21063 |work = [[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]] |publisher = [[Condé Nast]] ([[Advance Publications]]) |accessdate = November 24, 2015 }} and ''Harper's Bazaar Arabia.''{{cite news |url = http://www.vibe.com/2013/03/kendall-jenner-covers-harpers-bazaar-arabia-fashion-issue-photos/ |title = Kendall Jenner Covers 'Harper's Bazaar Arabia' Fashion Issue |last = Holmes |first = K. |date = March 27, 2013 |work = [[Vibe (magazine)|Vibe]] |publisher = [[Spin Media]] |accessdate = June 18, 2015 }} Jenner featured in James' ''Nomad Two Worlds: Australia'' book launches in [[Sydney]]{{cite web |url = https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.446923035343880.89047.124913234211530&type=1 |title = Nomad Two Worlds Book Launch Event Sydney |date = November 1, 2015 |website = [[Facebook]] |accessdate = November 24, 2015 }} and [[Los Angeles]]. Jenner's editorial work with signaled a change of direction to high fashion, and Jenner signed with [[The Society Management]] on November 21, 2013.{{cite web |last = Mau |first = Dhani |date = November 21, 2013 |title = Kendall Jenner Signs with the Society Management: It's a big step towards a legitimate modeling career for the reality TV star |url = http://fashionista.com/2013/11/kendall-jenner-signs-with-the-society-management |work = Fashionista |publisher = Breaking Media, Inc. |accessdate = June 18, 2015 }}{{cite web |last = Cope |first = Rebecca |date = November 22, 2013 |title = Kendall Jenner signs with modeling agency |url = http://www.harpersbazaar.co.uk/fashion/fashion-news/kendall-jenner-signs-with-modelling-agency |work = Jenner has also promoted various other non-signature products from the product line throughout the year. In February 2016, Jenner and beauty blogger Irene Kim became guest editors for the Estée Edit,{{cite news |url = http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-beauty/news/kendall-jenner-goes-nearly-naked-in-new-estee-edit-videos-w164139 |title = Kendall Jenner Strips Down to Her Underwear to Introduce the Estee Edit |last = Torgerson |first = Rachel |date = February 15, 2016 |work = [[Us Weekly]] |publisher = Wenner Media LLC |access-date = February 15, 2016 }} accompanied by a signature Eyeshadow Palette.{{cite journal |last = Quinn |first = Cat |date = February 17, 2016 |title = Exclusive: Kendall Jenner Reveals A Major Makeup Launch |url = http://www.refinery29.com/2016/02/103438/kendall-jenner-estee-lauder-eyeshadow-palette-interview |work = [[Refinery29]] |access-date = February 18, 2016 }} In September 2015, each of the Jenner and Kardashian sisters released paid subscription [[mobile app]] websites in collaboration with [[Whalerock Industries]].{{cite journal |last = Griffith |first = Erin |date = September 14, 2015 |title = Keeping App with the Kardashians |url = http://fortune.com/2015/09/14/kardashian-app-event/ |work = [[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]] |publisher = [[Time, Inc.]] |accessdate = September 24, 2015 }}{{cite web |last = Horniacek |first = Julia |date = September 14, 2015 |title = Kendall Jenner Launches KendallJ.Com For All Her Favorite Style Tips & Tricks |url = http://www.bustle.com/articles/110396-kendall-jenner-launches-kendalljcom-for-all-her-favorite-style-tips-tricks |work = [[Bustle (magazine)|Bustle]] |accessdate = September 24, 2015 }} Jenner's website was nominated for an [[International Academy of Digital Arts and Sciences]] 2016 [[Webby Award]] in April of that year. The Jenner sisters partnered with [[Glu Mobile]] to develop an app spinoff of ''[[Kim Kardashian: Hollywood]]'';{{cite journal |last = Shaul |first = Brandy |date = March 17, 2015 |title = Glu Mobile Partners with Kendall and Kylie Jenner for Upcoming Mobile Game |url = http://www.adweek.com/socialtimes/glu-mobile-partners-with-kendall-and-kylie-jenner-for-upcoming-mobile-game/617089 |work = [[Adweek]] |publisher = Mediabistro Holdings ([[Prometheus Global Media]]/[[Guggenheim Partners]]) |access-date = December 27, 2015 }} the ''Kendall and Kylie'' app launched February 17, 2016.{{cite journal |last = Reisinger |first = Don |date = February 16, 2016 |title = Kendall and Kylie Have Another Mobile App Hit |url = http://fortune.com/2016/02/17/kendall-kylie-mobile-app/ |work = [[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]] |publisher = [[Time Inc]] |access-date = February 16, 2016 }} In 2016, Jenner began a career as a photographer, her first published work was photographing and styling Kaia Gerber, daughter of iconic supermodel [[Cindy Crawford]], for the sixteenth anniversary issue of ''[[Love (magazine)|LOVE]]''. On February 10, 2016, lawyers representing Jenner Inc. filed a $10 million lawsuit against esthetic medical company Cutera at the [[United States District Court for the Central District of California]]. Jenner's legal team objected to the company using her brand without authorization. Cutera had featured Jenner in ad campaigns for its Laser Genesis acne treatment.{{cite news |url = https://www.cnbc.com/2016/02/11/kendall-jenner-sues-skin-care-company-over-ad.html |title = Kendall Jenner sues skin care company over ad |author = |date = February 11, 2016 |work = [[CNBC]] |publisher = [[NBCUniversal]] |access-date = February 18, 2016 }} In May 2016, Jenner's attorneys dropped the charges.{{cite journal |last = Ricevuto |first = Julie |date = May 5, 2016 |title = Balmain x H&M Catwalk And Party |url = https://www.yahoo.com/beauty/kendall-jenner-mysteriously-drops-10-million-202324375.html |work = Yahoo! Beauty |publisher = [[Yahoo!]] |access-date = May 5, 2016 }} In June 2017, Kendall and her sister, [[Kylie Jenner|Kylie]], launched a line of "vintage" T-shirts on their website for their lifestyle brand, Kendall + Kylie. The shirts retailed at $125 and featured logos or images of famous musicians or bands ([[Tupac Shakur]], [[The Doors]], [[Metallica]], [[Pink Floyd]], and [[The Notorious B.I.G.]]) with bright images or logos associated with the Jenners superimposed over them.{{cite web|last1=Fortin|first1=Jacey|title=Kylie and Kendall Jenner, Accused of Exploitation, Apologize for T-Shirts|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/06/30/arts/kylie-kendall-shirt-tupac.html|publisher=The New York Times|accessdate=July 8, 2017}} The shirts were met with criticism from the public, as well as several [[cease and desist]] letters from the estates of the musicians and artists that were featured without permission. The photographer whose portrait of Tupac Shakur was used has since sued the Jenner sisters for [[copyright infringement]].{{cite web|last1=Kreps|first1=Daniel|title=Photographer Sues Kylie, Kendall Jenner Over Tupac T-Shirt Image|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/photographer-sues-jenner-sisters-over-tupac-image-on-t-shirt-w491443|publisher=Rolling Stone|accessdate=July 8, 2017}} The sisters pulled the shirts from their website and issued a joint apology, "to anyone that has been upset and/or offended, especially to the families of the artists." ===Acting and reality television=== Jenner began her [[reality television]] career in 2007 as a [[supporting actor]] in her blended family's [[E!]] program ''[[Keeping Up with the Kardashians]]'' and its subsequent related spinoffs ''[[Kourtney and Khloé Take Miami]]'', ''[[Kourtney and Kim Take New York]]'', and ''[[Khloé & Lamar]]''. In 2010, Jenner was cast in boy band [[One Call]]'s ''Blacklight'' video along with [[Ashley Benson]] and [[Kevin McHale (actor)|Kevin McHale]]. In 2012, Jenner appeared as AJ on the ''I Ka Wa Mamua'' episode of ''[[Hawaii Five-0 (2010 TV series)|Hawaii Five-0]]''.{{cite web |url = http://www.accesshollywood.com/kendall-jenner-to-make-acting-debut-on-hawaii-five-0_article_68662 |title = Kendall Jenner To Make Acting Debut On Hawaii Five-0 |last = O'Sullivan |first = Erin |date = August 18, 2012 |work = [[Access Hollywood]] |publisher = [[NBCUniversal Television Distribution]] ([[Comcast|Comcast Corporation]]) |accessdate = September 24, 2015 }} Jenner did voiceover for the character Strawberry in ''[[The High Fructose Adventures of Annoying Orange]]'' episode ''Shakesparagus Speare'', which aired on January 20, 2014. In August 2014, Jenner appeared in singer [[PartyNextDoor]]'s video ''Recognize'' with sister Kylie Jenner and rapper [[Drake (rapper)|Drake]]. Jenner made a cameo appearance in the heist film ''[[Ocean's 8]]'', which was released on June 8, 2018.{{cite web|url=http://ew.com/movies/2017/01/17/kim-kardashian-kendall-jenner-oceans-eight-cameos/|title=Kim Kardashian and Kendall Jenner will make cameos in Ocean's Eight|website=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|first=Stephanie|last=Petit|date=January 17, 2017|accessdate=January 17, 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://people.com/movies/kim-kardashian-kendall-jenner-oceans-eight-cameo-photos-on-set/|title=Kim Kardashian and Kendall Jenner Are Making Cameos in Ocean's Eight|website=[[People (magazine)|People]]|first=Stephanie|last=Petit|date=January 17, 2017|accessdate=January 17, 2017}} === Writing === ''[[Seventeen (American magazine)|Seventeen]]'' magazine featured Kendall and Kylie Jenner as Style Stars of 2011{{cite web |last = Strauss |first = Erika |url = http://www.wetpaint.com/kendall-and-kylie-jenner-named-seventeen-magazines-style-stars-of-2011-697860/ |title = Kendall and Kylie Jenner Named Seventeen Magazine's Style Stars of 2011 |work = [[Wetpaint]] |publisher = Viggle Inc. |date = November 22, 2011 |accessdate = June 18, 2015 }} and selected them as "Style Ambassadors" for the magazine.{{cite web |url = http://www.sheknows.com/entertainment/articles/958241/kendall-and-kylie-jenner-land-seventeen-magazine-jobs |title = Kendall and Kylie Jenner land jobs with Seventeen |accessdate = June 19, 2015 |date ghostwriter Maya Sloan.{{cite web |last = Kaufman |first = Amy |url = http://www.latimes.com/books/jacketcopy/la-et-jc-maya-sloan-20140701-story.html#page=1 |title = For Maya Sloan, ghostwriting http://www.reganarts.com/spill/2016/05/regan-arts-to-publish-new-book-by-kendall-and-kylie-jenner/ |publisher = Regan Arts (a division of [[Phaidon Press]]) |access-date = May 24, 2016 }} to be released November 15, 2016. == Public image == [[File:Cannes 2017 15.jpg|thumb|Jenner at the [[2017 Cannes Film Festival]]]] Jenner was named as one of ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' magazine's 50 most beautiful people in the world on April 9, 2014.{{cite journal |author = |date = April 9, 2014 |title = World's Most Beautiful 2015: Kendall Jenner |url = http://www.people.com/people/package/gallery/0,,20913899_20804901_30135947,00.html#30135964 |work = [[People (magazine)|People]] |publisher = [[Time Inc]]|access-date = May 9, 2016 }} ''[[Time Influential Teens of 2014 |work = [[Time (magazine)|Time]] |publisher = [[Time Inc]] |date = October 13, 2014 |accessdate = June 18, 2015 }} and again in 2015.{{cite news |date = October 27, 2015 Top-Searched Models and Fashion Trends |url = http://www.vogue.com/13280024/top-searched-models-trends-2014/ |work = [[Style.com]] |publisher = [[Condé Nast]] ([[Advance Publications]]) |accessdate = June 18, 2015 }} Jenner debuted at No. 2 on ''[[FHM]]'''s annual [[FHM's 100 Sexiest Women (UK)|100 Sexiest Women in the World]] list at the end of April 2015.{{cite web |date = April 28, 2015 |title = FHM 100 Sexiest 2015 |url = http://www.fhm.com/100-sexiest-2015 |work = [[FHM]] |publisher = [[Bauer Media Group]] |accessdate = October 1, 2015 }} [[Tumblr]] named Jenner as its most reblogged model for 2015.{{cite web |url = http://yearinreview.tumblr.com/post/135257036062/most-reblogged-models |title = Most Reblogged Models |author = |date = n.d. |work = [[Tumblr]] |access-date = December 27, 2015 }} In November 2017, ''[[Forbes]]'' listed Jenner as the No.1 highest-paid model in the world.{{cite journal |author = |date = November 21, 2017 |title =Kendall Jenner is the world's highest paid model |url =https://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-42069786 |work = BBC News Entertainment |publisher = BBC News |access-date = November 21, 2017 }} === Impact of viral promotion upon fashion e-commerce === Jenner's rapid career ascent{{cite journal |last = Lester |first = Tracey Lomrantz |date = n.d. |title = It Pays To Be Social: The industry that has erupted within the modeling industry |url = http://www.crfashionbook.com/book/it-pays-to-be-social/ |work = CR Fashion Book |publisher = [[Carine Roitfeld]] |access-date = December 27, 2015 }} led ''[[Dazed]]'' magazine's editors to rank her top creative to watch out for in 2015 on their annual Dazed 100 list,{{cite web |title = Kendall: Changing The Face Of Fashion |url = http://www.dazeddigital.com/fashion/article/22718/1/kendall-changing-the-face-of-fashion |work = [[Dazed]] |publisher = Waddell Limited |accessdate = November 30, 2014 }} Jenner collaborated with the editors on a ''[[Mean Girls]]''-inspired "Burn Book" parody, which responded to her online bullies{{cite AV media|people=Goldsmith, Columbine (director)|date=November 28, 2014|title=Kendall Jenner's 'Burn Book'|medium=online video|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vsrjiL1gV6I|accessdate=November 28, 2014|publisher=[[Dazed]] on [[YouTube]]}} and industry detractors.{{cite journal |last = Duggan |first = Leeann |date = January 30, 2015 |title = The Fashion Establishment Is Mad About Instagram Models |url = http://www.refinery29.com/2015/01/81576/instagirls-backlash |work = [[Refinery29]] |access-date = December 30, 2015 }} The video was later shortlisted on September 22, 2015, for the [[International Academy of Digital Arts and Sciences]]' annual Lovie Awards in the Internet Viral Video category; The rapid ascension of the Instagirls has accelerated a decade-long reassessment of the interaction between fashion and mass consumption.{{cite journal |last = Leitch |first = Luke |date = May 3, 2016 |title = The sound of one hand tapping: Social media is disrupting and dividing the fashion world. Luke Leitch reports |url = https://www.1843magazine.com/style/the-sound-of-one-hand-tapping |work = [[1843 (magazine)|1843]] ([[The Economist]]) |publisher = [[Economist Group]] |access-date = May 17, 2016 }} Jenner's adeptness at connecting with [[Millennials]] online has given her access to a large demographic market, with the ability to segment her fanbase and find ideal clients. Designer Sally LaPorte claimed Jenner's approval of her line helped the designer key into the particulars of her ideal buyers.{{cite web |url = http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/sally-lapointe-kendall-jenner-style-865332 |title = How Kendall Jenner's Street Style Has Gotten Sally LaPointe's Designs More Recognition |last = Chan |first = Stephanie |date = February 15, 2016 |work = [[The Hollywood Reporter]] |publisher = [[Prometheus Global Media]] (a division of [[Guggenheim Partners]]) |access-date = February 18, 2016 }} Former Calvin Klein Women's Creative Director Francisco Costa praised Jenner's social cachet: "Her social media reach is just incredible […] As a house, you become part of the culture by embracing someone like her."{{cite journal |last = Ilyashov |first = Alexandra |date = March 23, 2016 |title = Kendall Jenner (Kind Of) Landed Her First U.S. Vogue Cover |url = http://www.refinery29.com/2016/03/106670/kendall-jenner-vogue-cover-special-edition |work = [[Refinery29]] |access-date = March 23, 2016 }} Jenner's ongoing participation in Calvin Klein promotions have proven to be profitable, as parent company the [[PVH (company)|Phillips-Van Heusen Corporation]] announced a 13% increase in Net Sales over the previous year's 1st quarter on May 26, 2016, with the financials also indicating a 10.5% increase in Revenue As Reported over the previous year's quarter, and a 20.1% increase in Constant Currency Earnings before Interest and Taxes over the previous year's quarter.{{cite press release |author = |date = May 25, 2016 |title = PVH Corp. Reports 2016 First Quarter Results above Guidance and Raises Full Year Non-GAAP EPS Guidance |url = http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20160525006341/en/ |publisher = [[Business Wire]] (a division of [[Berkshire Hathaway]]) |access-date = May 27, 2016 }} According to CEO [[Emanuel Chirico]], increased earnings reflect restructuring of the company's global creative strategy for Calvin Klein and its associated ''#MyCalvins'' ad campaigns.{{cite journal |last = Ryan |first = Kate |date = May 26, 2016 |title = Here’s How Much Kendall Jenner And Justin Bieber Influence Brands They Represent |url = http://elitedaily.com/entertainment/kendall-jenner-justin-bieber-influence-brands/1505878/ |work = [[Elite Daily]] |publisher = [[DMG Media]] (a subsidiary of [[Daily Mail and General Trust]]) }} Other brands have adapted in unique ways to the impact of high-profile influencers on their promotional efforts. Dear Frances footwear brand creative Jane Frances engineered an open-door branding strategy in such a way that her brand is able to successfully do promotional work either with or without influencer input.{{cite journal |last = Decker |first = Vivienne |date = May 2, 2016 |title = How Jane Frances Of Dear Frances Launched Bella Hadid And Kendall Jenner's Favorite New Shoe Brand |url = https://www.forbes.com/sites/viviennedecker/2016/05/02/how-jane-frances-of-dear-frances-launched-gigi-hadids-favorite-shoe-brand/#7cd3dc2b285d |work = [[Forbes]] |publisher = Forbes, Inc |access-date = May 2, 2016 }}{{cite journal |last = Coscarelli |first = Alyssa |date = April 29, 2016 |title = The "Year-Round" Black Boots Celebs Are Loving |url = http://www.refinery29.com/2016/04/109587/black-boots-dear-frances-kendall-jenner?unique_id=entry_109587#slide |work = [[Refinery29]] |access-date = May 2, 2016 }} European ice cream company Magnum moved aggressively into online branding initiatives by featuring [[Suki Waterhouse]] and Jenner{{cite web |url = http://www.campaignlive.co.uk/article/kendall-jenner-promotes-magnum-double-cannes/1394761?bulletin=campaign_1805 |title = Kendall Jenner promotes Magnum Double at Cannes |last = Degun |first = Gurjit |date = May 12, 2016 |work = [[Campaign (magazine)|Campaign]] |publisher = [[Haymarket Media Group]] |access-date = June 18, 2015 }} as company spokesmodels. In the midst of these changes, tech entrepreneur Frank Spadafora designed his company's D'Marie app as a fashion industry-specific [[Q Score]] alternative in order to effectly measure the monetary imprint fashion influencers and brand ambassadors are able to attain. The app's deployment worked to Jenner's advantage; she ranked as D'Marie's #1 fashion influencer across all categories as of February 19, 2016,{{cite web |url = http://www.dmariearchive.com/rankings |title = Ranking |author = |date = n.d. |website = ''D'Marie'' |access-date = December 27, 2015 }} with the ability to earn between {{US$|125,000}} and {{US$|300,000}} for a single update to her social media platforms.{{cite journal |last = Heine |first = Christopher |date = December 4, 2015 |title = These 4 Celebrity Influencers Can Charge $230,000 for a Single Brand Post – Kendall Jenner is among the leaders |url = http://www.adweek.com/news/technology/these-5-celebrity-influencers-can-charge-230000-every-time-they-post-brand-168466 |work = [[Adweek]] |publisher = Mediabistro Holdings ([[Prometheus Global Media]]/[[Guggenheim Partners]]) |access-date = December 27, 2015 }}{{cite journal |last = Todd |first = Caroline |date = December 18, 2015 |title = Kendall Jenner Makes HOW MUCH Per Social Media Post? |url = http://www.refinery29.com/2015/12/99851/models-making-millions-social-media |work = [[Refinery29]] |access-date = March 11, 2016 }} ===2017 Pepsi advertisement=== {{main|Live for Now (Pepsi)}} Jenner was at the center of public scrutiny in April 2017 after starring in a commercial for [[Pepsi]] called "[[Live for Now (Pepsi)|Live for Now]]". The commercial cast her in a role in which she used the beverage to make peace between police officers and protesters.{{Cite news|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/nbcblk/pepsi-ad-kendall-jenner-echoes-black-lives-matter-sparks-anger-n742811|title='We missed the mark': Pepsi pulls ad featuring Kendall Jenner after controversy|work=NBC News|access-date=May 16, 2017|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/05/business/kendall-jenner-pepsi-ad.html|title=Pepsi Pulls Ad Accused of Trivializing Black Lives Matter|last=Victor|first=Daniel|date=April 5, 2017|work=The New York Times|access-date=May 16, 2017|issn=0362-4331}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.wired.com/2017/04/pepsi-ad-internet-response/|title=Pepsi’s New Kendall Jenner Ad Was So Bad It Actually United the Internet|last=Watercutter|first=Angela|work=WIRED|access-date=May 16, 2017|language=en-US}} This ad was criticized for borrowing imagery from the [[Black Lives Matter]] movement and trivializing the protests against police brutality, particularly as it affects African Americans. Pepsi pulled the ad within a day, and apologized to Jenner for "putting [her] in this position." She was reportedly "devastated" by the ad, although she "had the right to approve the ad before it was released". According to the same source, Jenner's contract with Pepsi prohibited her from commenting on the fallout.{{cite news|title=Kendall Jenner Is Reportedly "Devastated" Over the Pulled Pepsi Ad|url=http://www.elle.com/culture/celebrities/news/a44371/kendall-jenner-devastated-over-the-pulled-pepsi-ad-report/|publisher=[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]]|last=Baily|first=Alyssa|date=April 5, 2017}} == Personal life == In May 2014, Jenner purchased a two-bedroom, 2.5-bath condominium in Los Angeles for {{US$|1.4{{nbsp}}million}}.{{cite news |last = Rivera |first = Zayda |url = http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/kendall-jenner-buys-1-4-million-condo-report-article-1.1806739 |title = Kendall Jenner buys $1.4 million condo in exclusive Los Angeles neighborhood: report |work = [[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]] |location = New York |accessdate = June 19, 2015 |date = May 27, 2014 }} She prefers not to publicly discuss her love life.{{cite news |url = http://www.etonline.com/news/172192_exclusive_kendall_jenner_explains_why_she_never_publicly_dated_anyone/ |title = Kendall Jenner Explains Why She's Never Publicly Dated Anyone |last = Bueno |first = Antoinette |date = September 18, 2015 |work = [[Entertainment Tonight]] |publisher = [[CBS Television Distribution]] ([[CBS Corporation]]) |accessdate = September 22, 2015 }} Jenner has said on her blog that she has a shy personality{{cite journal |author = |date = February 16, 2016 |title = Kendall Jenner on Being Shy Compared to Her 'Much Louder' Kardashian Sisters: I'm 'Not Much of a Talker' |url = http://www.people.com/article/kendall-jenner-opens-up-being-shy-much-louder-sisters |work = [[People (magazine)|People]] |publisher = [[Time Inc]] |access-date = February 16, 2016 }} and wrote on her app, "I 100 percent identify as Christian."{{cite web |url = http://www.marieclaire.com/celebrity/news/a20449/kendall-jenner-faith/ |title = Kendall Jenner Reveals Her Religious Beliefs |work = [[Marie Claire]] |publisher = [[Hearst (media)|Hearst Corporation]] |date = May 10, 2016 |accessdate = May 22, 2016 |author = Bruk, Diane }} In October 2017, Jenner bought a house in [[Mulholland Estates]], a gated community in Los Angeles. http://www.yolandaslittleblackbook.com/blog-1/2017/10/23/kendall-jenner-new-house-mulholland-estates/ === Charity === Jenner set up an [[eBay]] account where she auctions old clothing to raise money for [[Children's Hospital Los Angeles]]. The Kardashian and Jenner sisters used eBay in this way to raise money for their charities in 2013.{{cite web |last = Rees |first = Alex |date = February 14, 2014 |title = In The Past Year, The Kardashians Made Over $270,000 Selling Their Old Clothes on eBay |url = http://www.cosmopolitan.com/entertainment/celebs/news/a20501/kardashian-family-ebay-sales-wow/ |work = [[Cosmopolitan (magazine)|Cosmopolitan]] |publisher = [[Hearst Corporation]] |accessdate = June 18, 2015 }} Jenner joined her family in a charity yard sale on November 10, 2013.{{cite web |last = Gicas |first = Peter |url = http://www.eonline.com/news/479649/kim-kardashian-and-family-hold-yard-sale-to-raise-money-for-charity-see-the-pics |title = Kim Kardashian and Family Hold Yard Sale to Raise Money for Charity—See the Pics! |publisher = E! News (NBCUniversal) |date = November 11, 2013 |accessdate = June 18, 2015 }} Proceeds from the sale were donation-matched and sent to [[Share Our Strength]]: No Kid Hungry and the [[Fisher House Foundation|Greater Los Angeles Fisher House Foundation]]. Jenner and Kim Kardashian attended a Christmas Eve visit with the kids at [[Children's Hospital Los Angeles]] on Tuesday December 24, 2013.{{cite web |url = http://www.eonline.com/shows/kardashians/news/493728/kim-kardashian-and-kendall-jenner-bring-christmas-cheer-to-los-angeles-hospital |title = Kim Kardashian and Kendall Jenner Bring Christmas Cheer to Los Angeles Hospital |date = December 25, 2013 |first = Jenna |last = Mullins |accessdate = December 1, 2015 |publisher = E! News (NBCUniversal) }} Jenner joined Khloe Kardashian, [[Lil Twist]], and [[The Game (rapper)|The Game]] at PINZ bowling alley in Studio City, California, for a charity bowling game on January 19, 2014. The event was held to raise money for [[Robin Hood Foundation|The Robin Hood Foundation]], a nonprofit for which The Game pledged to raise $1 million USD in donations.{{cite web|url=https://wikifamous.com/kendall-jenner/#Kendall_Jenner_Night_Out_With_Her_Sisters|title=Khloé Kardashian, Kendall Jenner And Kylie Jenner Enjoy A Night Of Charity Bowling With The Game And Lil Twist|last=|first=|date=January 19, 2014|work=[[WikiFamous]]|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|accessdate=December 1, 2018}}{{Dead link|date=June 2016}} The Jenner sisters participated in singer [[Chris Brown]]'s two Kick'n It For Charity Celebrity Kickball games in Glendale, California, on July 19, 2014{{cite web |url = http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-juice/6171324/chris-brown-quincy-host-celebrity-kickball-game-in-los-angeles |title = Chris Brown & Quincy Host Celebrity Kickball Game in Los Angeles (Photos) |accessdate = October 24, 2015 |date = July 20, 2014 |first = Mitchell |last = Peters |publisher = Hollywood Reporter-Billboard Media Group ([[Prometheus Global Media]]/[[Guggenheim Partners]]) |work = [[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] }} and on August 16, 2014.{{cite web |last = Heller |first = Corinne |url = http://www.eonline.com/news/570113/kendall-jenner-sports-chic-football-inspired-look-at-charity-game-hugs-rapper-the-game-see-the-photos |title = Kendall Jenner Sports Chic, Football-Inspired Look at Charity Game, Hugs Rapper The Game |publisher = E! News (NBCUniversal) |date = August 17, 2014 |accessdate = June 18, 2015 }} Jenner, [[Ansel Elgort]], Gigi Hadid, and Jenner's agent Ashleah Gonzales encountered unhoused model/actor John Economou in Venice Beach during a fashion shoot on January 31, 2015, a meeting which led to Economou being signed to a Two Management contract by company president Luc Brinker.{{cite journal|last=Ongley |first=Hannah |date=December 15, 2015 |title=Meet the Homeless Hippie Skater That Kendall Jenner and Gigi Turned Into a Model |url=http://www.details.com/story/kendall-jenner-and-gigi-hadid-just-scored-this-homeless-skater-a-modeling-contract |dead-url=yes |work=[[Details (magazine)|Details]] |publisher = [[Condé Nast]] ([[Advance Publications]]) |access-date=December 27, 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160106214008/http://www.details.com/story/kendall-jenner-and-gigi-hadid-just-scored-this-homeless-skater-a-modeling-contract |archivedate=January 6, 2016 }} On February 14, 2015, Jenner appeared at Marc Jacobs' Bookmarc store in New York City for the launch of [[LOVE (magazine)|LOVE]] issue 13. She posed in a limited-edition T-shirt sale to raise proceeds for [[Designers Against AIDS]].{{cite web |url = http://www.designersagainstaids.com/news/item/kendall_jenner_and_neville_jacobs_pose_up_a_storm_in_tees_by_marc_jacobs_x_love_for_daa |title = Kendall Jenner And Neville Jacobs Pose Up A Storm In Tees By Marc Jacobs X LOVE For DAA! |last = Murk |first = Ninette |date = February 18, 2015 |work = Designers Against AIDS |accessdate = November 21, 2015 }} On November 3, 2017, Jenner celebrated her 22nd birthday by raising funds for Charity:Water!, which provides clean drinking water for those in need. == Filmography == ;As herself {|class="wikitable sortable" |- ! revision.text:
{{Multiple issues| {{external links|date=October 2012}} {{unreferenced|date=February 2010}} {{advert|date=February 2010}} }} '''NORMAPME''' or '''European Office of Crafts, Trades and Small and Medium-sized Enterprises for Standardisation''' was created in 1996 by [[UEAPME]] with the support of the [[European Commission]]. German name is: ''Europäisches Büro des Handwerks und der Klein- und Mittelbetriebe für Normung''.<ref>[http://www.din-mitteilungen.de/sixcms_upload/media/2666/NAW%20Jahresbbericht%202010.108478.pdf Jahresbericht 2010 ￼Normenausschuss Wasserwesen (NAW) im DIN] 2010, retrieved 21 March 2017.</ref>
NORMAPME participates/-ed in the standardisation process on behalf of SMEs and is an associate member of [[European Committee for Standardization|CEN]], [[International Organization for Standardization|ISO]], [[CENELEC]] & [[ETSI]].
NORMAPME has been suspended earlier to the delegates meeting of EMU ([[European Metal Union]]) 19 September 2013 in Austria.<ref>[http://www.emu-sme.eu/de/europaeische-metallunion-emu-delegiertenversammlung-2013 Europäische Metallunion-EMU Delegiertenversammlung 2013] EMU, 19–21 September 2013, retrieved 21 March 2017. – German.</ref>
== Activities ==
*Technical Committees: NORMAPME recruits experts from SME organisations to follow and report the work in European and International TCs in their fields of expertise. *Political Interventions: Political influence is possible for NORMAPME through its membership in ISO, CEN, CENELEC & ETSI and through our recognition by the European Commission. *Projects: NORMAPME aims at providing tools for SMEs and creating European networks
== Information policy ==
Any SMEs can regularly receive from NORMAPME updates on standardisation mandates, ongoing technical committees, issues and stakes for SMEs, and assistance to obtain CE marking, etc...
All publications and the website are translated in six languages: English, French, German, Spanish, Italian and Polish.
== Members == Founding members:
UEAPME : [http://www.ueapme.com Union Européenne de l'Artisanat et des Petites et Moyennes Enterprises]
EBC: [http://www.eubuilders.org European Builders Confederation]
EMU: [http://www.emu-online.info European Metal Union]
JEUNE : [http://www.jeune-pme.eu Jeunes Entrepreneurs de l'Union Européene]
IFD: [http://www.ifd-roof.eu International Federation for the Roofing Trade]
Full members
CINET : [http://www.cinet-online.net Comité International de l'Entretien du Textile]
ECAP: [http://www.ecap-sme.org European Consortium of Anchors Produces]
FEPPD : [http://www.feppd.org Fédération Européenne et Internationale des Patrons Prothésístes Dentaires]
[http://www.eurowindoor.org EUROWINDOOR]
EVH: [http://evh.biz Europäsische Vereinigung des Holzbaus]
GCI-UICP : [http://www.gci-uicp.eu Génie Climatique International-Union internationale de la plombiere et de la couverture]
BIPAVER : [http://www.bipaver.org Bureau International Permanent des Associates de Vendeurs et Rechapeurs de pneumatiques]
EWA: [http://www.freizeitbad.de European Waterpark Association]
EFESME: [http://www.efesme.org/ European Federation for Elevator Small and Medium-sized Enterprises]
ELCA: [http://www.elca-europe.org European Lift Components Association]
EMM: European Multifoil Manufacturers
Associate members
FIDEM: [http://www.fidem.net Fundació International de la Dona Emprenedora]
SFIRMM : [http://www.sfirmm.com Syndicat des Fabricants d’Isolants Réflecteurs Minces Multicouches]
FNS : [http://www.houtinfobois.be Fédération Nationale des Scieries]
Partners
COSBOA: [http://www.cosboa.org Council of Small Business of Australia]
== External links ==
* [http://www.normapme.com NORMAPME, the "European Office of Crafts, Trades and Small and Medium sized Enterprises for Standardisation"] * [http://www.cen.eu The European Committee for Standardization (CEN)] * [http://www.cenelec.eu The European Committee for Electrotechnical Standardization (CENELEC)] * [http://www.etsi.org The European Telecommunications Standards Institute (ETSI)] * [http://www.cen.eu European Commission, DG Enterprise and Industry, Standardisation and SMEs, (link and references to NORMAPME)]
== References == <references />

revision.comment: +{{[[Template:Authority control|Authority control]]}} (2 sources from Wikidata), [[WP:GenFixes]] on, using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{{BLP sources|date=April 2011}} {{Infobox person | name = Nerio Alessandri | image = Nerio Alessandri.jpg | caption = Alessandri | image_size = 250px | birth_name = Nerio Alessandri | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1961|4|8}} | birth_place = [[Gatteo]], [[Province of Forlì-Cesena|F-C]], [[Italy]] | occupation = Entrepreneur | years_active = 1983–present | website = <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.technogym.com/gb/company/about-us/nerio-alessandri/481 |title=Nerio Alessandri, directeur van Technogym, The Wellness Company |publisher=Technogym.com |date= |accessdate=2012-06-12}}</ref> | nationality = Italian }}
'''Nerio Alessandri''' ([[Gatteo]], [[Province of Forlì-Cesena]], 8 April 1961) is an Italian entrepreneur <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fitnesschic.it/interview/technogym-nerio-alessandri.html |title=Interview: Nerio Alessandri |publisher=Fitnesschic.it |date= |accessdate=2012-06-12}}</ref> and President and founder of [[Technogym]] (since 1983).
==Biography== {{BLP unsourced section|date=February 2017}} In 1983 Nerio Alessandri founded Technogym, and began building exercise equipment in the garage of his home.
In 1984 he designed the Isotonic Line, the very first Technogym training line for gyms and then in 1986 came Unica, the first, hi-tech design, home trainer.
In 1988 he patented the CPR system, a scientific algorithm for constant pulse/heart rate training that became the hallmark of Technogym products.
In 1993 at the 1st California Tradefair International Conference in Rimini, Alessandri defined his Wellness concept: a lifestyle based on regular physical activity, balanced diet and a positive outlook. From this moment on Wellness became the foundation of the Technogym philosophy and the tagline “The Wellness Company” was added to the corporate logo.
In 2001 Alessandri was nominated “Cavaliere del Lavoro” (Knight of Industry) by the President of the Italian Republic Carlo Azeglio Ciampi, which made him the youngest-ever holder of this title in Italian history.
In November 2003 he was named Italian “Entrepreneur of the Year 2003” and then represented Italy at the “World Entrepreneur of the Year”.
In March 2004 he was elected to the Association of Italian Industrialists (Confindustria) Board of Directors and this mandate was renewed in 2008 for the next four years.
In April 2004 he received an honorary degree (Laurea Honoris Causa) from the Faculty of Motor Sciences at the University of Urbino.
In November 2004 he was presented the Leonardo Award for Italian Quality by the President of the Italian Republic.
In April 2005 he received an [[honorary degree]] (Laurea ''[[ad honorem]]'') from the Faculty of Biomedical Engineering at the University of Bologna.
In November 2007 the United States Chamber of Commerce named Nerio Alessandri entrepreneur of the year in the economics category.
In February 2009 he was nominated Vice President of the Leonardo Committee, an association that promotes Italian quality and the image of Italy throughout the world.
In September 2009 Nerio Alessandri was nominated “World Heart Champion” by the World Heart Federation, the cardiology association of the World Health Organisation, for his commitment to promoting Wellness and a healthy lifestyle.
In May 2010 he was awarded the Guido Carli Award for the “Corporate Social Responsibility” category.
He received the ''America Award'' of the [[Italy-USA Foundation]] in 2017.
==Honours== [[File:Insegna.jpeg|Insegna]] Cavaliere del Lavoro – (''Knight of Industry'').<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.quirinale.it/elementi/DettaglioOnorificenze.aspx?decorato=45721 |title=Presidenza della Repubblica |publisher=Quirinale.it |date= |accessdate=2012-06-12}}</ref>
==Wellness==
Wellness<ref>{{cite web | title = The born of the word "Wellness" | url = http://ricerca.repubblica.it/repubblica/archivio/repubblica/2011/02/07/le-soluzioni-di-mr-wellness-cosi-technogym.html}}</ref> is a lifestyle based on regular physical activity, balanced diet and a positive outlook, first defined by Nerio Alessandri<ref>{{cite web|last=Larkworthy |first=Jane |url=http://www.wmagazine.com/beauty/2010/06/technogym |title=Beauty: Health: Fitness: Technogym: Beauty |publisher=Wmagazine.com |date= |accessdate=2012-06-12}}</ref> in the early 90s. The concept of Wellness is founded on the ancient Roman maximum of ''mens sana in corpore sano'' (a healthy mind in a healthy body) and is a genuine alternative to the American concept of fitness.<ref>{{cite web | title = Nerio Alessandri idea of fitness | url = http://www.howtospendit.com/#/articles/2756-the-captains-table-nerio-alessandri}}</ref> Fitness focuses on a small group of sports enthusiasts, whereas Wellness speaks to a much wider range of people who wish to improve their lifestyle.
In 2003, at the Wellness Congress organized in Cesena by the Wellness Foundation, Alessandri launched the slogan “Stare bene conviene” (Wellness pays) to highlight that a good psycho-physical condition is an all round advantage. For individuals who enjoy a better life. For companies, who can count on a more creative, more productive, more focused team. And for public health expenditure too, as a healthier population has less need of the National Health Service.
==Wellness Foundation==
In 2003 the Wellness Foundation was established. This no profit association supports scientific research, health education and the promotion of a Wellness lifestyle. The Foundation operates with specific projects in the sphere of health, instruction, research, art and culture. This foundation is the expression of the entrepreneur’s social responsibility, as it decides how to use its capital in social utility projects aimed at improving people’s quality of life with a particular emphasis on the local area in which the company is based. This is why one of the main initiatives promoted by the Foundation is the “Wellness Valley, Romagna Benessere” project with the aim of enhancing the natural characteristics of the Romagna region and establishing it as a leader in terms of people’s quality of life.
Moreover, in 2007, the Wellness Foundation promoted the “Cesena città che cammina” (Cesena, the walking city) project, which offered local people a free health check up and advice on illness prevention.
In 2008, together with the Municipality of Cesena and the local health service, the Foundation conducted a survey on the level of physical exercise practised by young people in Cesena. For many years now, the Foundation has worked together with a number of major prevention, research and care organizations to provide information and raise awareness of health issues. These organizations include the Istituto Oncologico Romagnolo (Romagna Oncology Institute), the Lega Italiana Lotta ai Tumori (Italian Tumour Prevention League), and the Fondazione Italiana per il Cuore e Diabete Italia (Italian Heart and Diabetes Foundation) .
The Foundation also promotes the Wellness Congress, the main event for promoting and raising awareness of Wellness issues. The first congress was held in Cesena in 2003, and has since met every year in various countries around the world. Through the shared experiences of doctors, entrepreneurs, fashion designers, architects, and celebrities from the worlds of sport, culture and institutions, the Wellness Congress demonstrates how a healthy lifestyle can concretely improve people's quality of life, corporate performance and state expenditure.
==Technogym==
Nerio Alessandri<ref>{{cite web|author=27 gennaio 2011 |url=http://www.ilsole24ore.com/art/economia/2011-01-26/rimboccarsi-maniche-ripartire-233021.shtml |title=Rimboccarsi le maniche per ripartire |publisher=Il Sole 24 ORE |date=2011-01-26 |accessdate=2012-06-12}}</ref> is the [[Technogym]] President and CEO. Today, Technogym is a world leader <ref>[[Hermann Simon]] mentioned this company in his correspondent Book as an example of a "[[Hidden Champions|Hidden Champion]]" (Simon, Hermann: Hidden Champions of the 21st Century : Success Strategies of unknown World Market Leaders. London: Springer, 2009.- {{ISBN|978-0-387-98147-5}}.)</ref> in the Fitness and Wellness solutions sector and boasts approximately 55,000 installations worldwide in 35,000 wellness centres and 20,000 private homes. Estimates suggest that approximately 20 million people use Technogym products every day. The company has 2000 employees in 13 branches in Europe, the United States, Asia, the Middle East, Australia and South America and 90% of its turnover is made up of exports sent to over 100 different countries. Its revenues are 350M in 2010.<ref name="italiaoggi1">{{cite web|url=http://www.italiaoggi.it/news/dettaglio_news.asp?id=201009091002001520&chkAgenzie=PMFNW&sez=news&testo=&titolo=Technogym:%20ricavi%20+21%%20e%20a%20fine%20anno%20350%20mln%20di%20fatturato%20(MF) |title=Technogym: ricavi +21% e a fine anno 350 mln di fatturato (MF) - News - Italiaoggi |publisher=Italiaoggi.it |date= |accessdate=2012-06-12}}</ref> This company was the exclusive and official supplier for the athletes training centers at the last 4 editions of the Olympic Games since Sydney 2000 to Beijing 2008 Olympic Games<ref>{{cite web |url=http://en.beijing2008.cn/99/88/article214018899.shtml |title=Technogym becomes the Fitness Equipment Exclusive Supplier of the Beijing 2008 Olympic Games |publisher=En.beijing2008.cn |date= |accessdate=2012-06-12 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120929235546/http://en.beijing2008.cn/99/88/article214018899.shtml |archivedate=29 September 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> and will be the same for [[2012 Summer Olympics|London 2012 Olympics]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.london2012.com/news/2010/07/london-2012-signs-technogym-as-fitness-equipment-supplie.php |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-09-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100818042722/http://www.london2012.com/news/2010/07/london-2012-signs-technogym-as-fitness-equipment-supplie.php |archivedate=18 August 2010 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
==Other entrepreneurial experiences==
At the beginning of 2003 Alessandri became a shareholder in [[Enervit]], a leading company in the sports nutrition sector.
In 2006 he purchased a 40% stake in Starpool, a company based in Trentino specialised in the design and construction of health spas.
==Publications==
In 2001 Alessandri published the book “Wellness. Scegli di vivere bene”<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.unilibro.it/find_buy/Scheda/libreria/autore-alessandri_nerio/sku-722969/wellness_scegli_di_vivere_bene_la_filosofia_di_mr_technogym_.htm |title=Wellness. Scegli di vivere bene! La filosofia di Mr. Technogym - Nerio Alessandri - Libro - UNILIBRO - Mondadori - Comefare - La grande Libreria Online |publisher=Unilibro.it |date= |accessdate=2012-06-12}}</ref> (Wellness. Welcome to a better life) the manual-manifesto of the Wellness philosophy. In 2005 Technogym and Nerio Alessandri featured in the Italian edition of ''Blue Ocean Strategy''< ({{ISBN|978-1591396192}}), the Chan Kim – Mauborgne best seller. Featured in the 2007 publication ''Soft Economy'' ({{ISBN|978-8817008372}}), Technogym was a case study in sound and flexible Italian enterprise that represents the best of Made in Italy. In the same year he edited the publication “Wellness-Storia e Cultura del vivere bene”<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.libreriadellosport.it/libri/wellness.php |title=Wellness-Storia E Cultura Del Vivere Bene , Alessandri Viroli |publisher=Libreriadellosport.it |date= |accessdate=2012-06-12}}</ref> (Wellness-The History and Culture of Healthy Living) (Sperling & Kupfer), a volume that defines the historical and conceptual path of wellness through twelve essays written by Italian and international academics. In 2008, the book “A Successful Life Begins with Wellness” was published in China. This volume defines the concept of wellness in oriental society and includes personal testimonies by Nerio Alessandri and other important figures in the world of Chinese culture, business, sport and show business, describing how they have achieved success through Wellness. In 2010 featured in the Bill Emmott best seller ''Forza, Italia - Come ripartire dopo Berlusconi'' ({{ISBN|978-8817044929}}) as an example of Italian excellence.
==References== {{Reflist}}
== External links ==
{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2011}} {{Authority control}}
